Interface SqlGenerator

All Known Implementing Classes:
MySqlGenerator, OracleGenerator, PostgreGenerator
public interface SqlGenerator
Defines the contract for components capable of converting a SchemaModel into SQL DDL (Data Definition Language) statements.

This interface is implemented by database-specific generators (MySQL, PostgreSQL, Oracle), each responsible for producing SQL compatible with a particular DBMS.

The interface also includes the helper method generateLogged(SchemaModel), which wraps SQL generation with logging and uniform error handling.

Design Pattern: Strategy Pattern

  • Field Details

    • log

      static final org.apache.logging.log4j.Logger log
      Shared logger instance used by all SQL generators.

  • Method Details

    • generate

      String generate(SchemaModel schema)
      Generates SQL DDL statements based on the provided schema.
      Parameters:
      schema - the input schema model; must not be null
      Returns:
      SQL string
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the schema is null

    • generateLogged

      default String generateLogged(SchemaModel schema)
      Wraps generate(SchemaModel) with logging.

      This method:

      • Validates schema is not null
      • Logs start of generation
      • Logs schema details in debug mode
      • Delegates SQL generation
      • Logs SQL length and preview
      • Logs errors and rethrows
      Parameters:
      schema - the schema to convert into SQL
      Returns:
      generated SQL
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if schema is null
